background.description: Deep Burgundy: A rich, dark red that works well as a subtle background.
Maroon: A dark brownish-red providing depth without being too intense.
Dark Red: A deep, intense red that creates a striking background.
Blood Red: An extremely dark red with excellent contrast capabilities.
Black Bean: A very dark reddish-brown, almost black with red undertones.

text.description: Light Coral Red: A bright but not harsh red, ideal for highlighting text.
Light Red: A soft red with good visibility against dark backgrounds.
Red Accent: A vibrant red that stands out without straining the eyes.
Light Coral: A pale red with excellent readability.
Soft Red: A very light, pastel red for subtle emphasis.

background.description: Forest Green: A deep, dark green reminiscent of dense forests.
Brunswick Green: A dark blue-green that's easy on the eyes.
Deep Teal: A dark green with blue undertones, creating a sophisticated look.
Dark Forest: An extremely dark green providing strong contrast.
Sacramento Green: A deep, rich green with balanced darkness.

text.description: Dark Sea Green: A mid-tone green with excellent readability.
Light Green: A bright but soft green that pops on dark backgrounds.
Pastel Green: A light, minty green with high visibility.
Pale Green: A soft, luminous green for important text elements.
Very Light Green: An extremely light green for subtle highlighting.

background.description: Dark Bronze: A very dark yellow-brown with excellent contrast properties.
Olive Brown: A dark, muted yellow with brown undertones.
Dark Olive: A deeper yellow with earthy characteristics.
Army Green: A dark yellow-green that feels grounded and stable.
Golden Brown: A rich, dark gold with sophisticated presence.

text.description: Lemon Yellow: A bright yellow that stands out vividly on dark backgrounds.
Pale Yellow: A soft yellow with excellent readability.
Gold: A rich yellow with good contrast and emphasis.
Light Yellow: A soft, pastel yellow for gentle highlighting.
Lemon Chiffon: A very light yellow for subtle accents.

background.description: Dark Brown: A deep orange-brown that creates a warm, rich background.
Burnt Sienna: A dark orange with rich brown undertones.
Chocolate: A deep, warm brown with orange hints.
Caput Mortuum: An extremely dark reddish-brown with orange undertones.
Bistre: A dark, smoky brown with warm characteristics.

text.description: Pastel Orange: A soft orange with good visibility against dark backgrounds.
Light Salmon: A light orange-pink that stands out without being harsh.
Atomic Tangerine: A bright but not overwhelming orange for emphasis.
Peach: A very light orange that's gentle on the eyes.
Peach Puff: An extremely light orange for subtle highlights.

background.description: Off-Black: A very dark gray that's softer than true black.
Charleston Green: A dark gray that reduces eye strain.
Raisin Black: A very dark gray with slight warmth.
Jet: A deep gray with excellent contrast properties.
Dark Charcoal: A medium-dark gray that's easier on the eyes than pure black.

text.description: White Smoke: A slightly softened white with reduced glare.
Cultured: A very light gray that appears white but with less intensity.
Platinum: A soft white with a hint of gray for readability.
Gainsboro: A light gray that reduces eye strain compared to pure white.
Light Gray: A soft gray that maintains good contrast on dark backgrounds.

background.description: True Black: The darkest color, perfect for OLED displays.
Night: A nearly-black color with just a hint of visibility.
Midnight: A very dark gray that's slightly softer than pure black.
Onyx: A rich, deep almost-black that's easier on the eyes.
Noir: A cinematic black with subtle depth.

text.description: Silver: A medium gray with excellent readability on dark backgrounds.
Dark Gray: A balanced gray for less emphasized text.
Gray: A medium gray for secondary content.
Light Gray: A soft gray that stands out well against dark backgrounds.
Dim Gray: A darker gray for subtle, less emphasized text.

background.description: Dark Blue: A deep blue providing strong contrast and depth.
Midnight Blue: A very dark blue with purple undertones.
Deep Navy: An extremely dark blue, almost black.
Dark Navy: A rich blue with balanced darkness.
Duke Blue: A deep, intense blue with good contrast properties.

text.description: Sky Blue: A light, bright blue with excellent visibility.
Light Blue: A soft, pastel blue that's easy to read.
Powder Blue: A very light blue with a hint of green.
Deep Sky Blue: A vibrant blue that pops against dark backgrounds.
Light Cyan: An extremely light blue for subtle emphasis.

background.description: Indigo: A deep purple with excellent contrast properties.
Dark Purple: A rich, deep purple with balanced darkness.
Indigo Purple: A deep purple with blue undertones.
Russian Violet: An extremely dark purple with subtle richness.
Persian Indigo: A deep, rich purple with royal characteristics.

text.description: Lavender: A very light purple that's gentle on the eyes.
Thistle: A soft, muted purple with good readability.
Plum: A medium-light purple with good emphasis.
Periwinkle: A light blue-purple with excellent visibility.
Light Purple: A soft, medium-light purple that stands out well.
